main event: On October 11, 1953, in Waubun, Minnesota, a civilian reported observing several circular or spherical objects glowing white in color and stationary in the sky for 1-2 minutes. The conclusion drawn from this observation was that it was likely a hallucinatory or hoax event.
interesting points: The observed objects were described as circular or spherical in shape, glowing white, and stationary in the sky.
The sighting lasted for 1-2 minutes, and there were no photographs taken.
A young farmer, Mr. J. L. Cha, made the observation and was well-known in the town of Waubun, Minnesota.
A similar observation was reported in April 1953, describing buzzing sounds and the appearance of a large flat disk with slender trailing antenna-like features.
A request was made for a thorough interrogation of the source of the report to determine if there was an exaggeration of the observation.
sighted object: several circular or spherical objects glowing white in color and stationary in the sky
